pullrequest.title: Fixing const-correctness for operator* of Pose3

content.raw: Regarding converting to `Matrix4` and then multiplying, if you have the knowledge ahead of time that both objects are homogeneous transformation matrices, you can save yourself some floating point operations, because you can do `p1 + R1*p2` and then `R1*R2` instead of `M1*M2`. Granted, you only save something like 31 floating point operations out of 112 (~27% savings), but I'll take what I can get, especially when it's such a crucial and frequently used operation.
